meanings.definition: A licensing arrangement in which a copyright holder allows others to freely distribute and modify their work, as long as the same permissions are passed on to subsequent users.
meanings.sent1: The copyleft of the software enabled everyone to share and improve it.
meanings.sent2: The copyleft of the book allowed readers to make copies and share them with friends.
meanings.sent3: The copyleft of the song made it possible for musicians to remix it in creative ways.
meanings.sent4: The copyleft of the painting opened up new possibilities for artists to collaborate.
meanings.sent5: The copyleft of the design ensured that it would always be freely available to all.
